sajjati.example_1: How does this one coalesce in the womb?”

sānu.sutta_1: tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā upāsikāya sānu nāma putto yakkhena gahito hoti.
sānu.example_1: Now at that time a certain lay woman had a son named Sānu who had been seized by a native spirit.
sānu.comment: son named Sānu who had been seized by a native spirit.

bhaddante.example_1: Hurry up, good luck to you!

nibhataṃ.example_1:
abhidhāvatha bhaddante,
kassa ujjhāpayāmase,
ādittā nīhataṃ [nibbhataṃ,
nibhataṃ] bhaṇḍaṃ,
puna ḍayhitumicchasīti.

jālini.example_1: there are no more abodes for me in the host of gods.

tosesi.sutta_1: atha kho piyaṅkaramātā yakkhinī puttakaṃ evaṃ tosesi:
tosesi.example_1: Then the native spirit Piyaṅkara’s Mother soothed her little child, saying:

sīvako.example_1: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nagaramhā nikkhamantassa āloko antaradhāyi, andhakāro pāturahosi, bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso udapādi, tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi. atha kho sivako [sīvako] yakkho antarahito saddamanussāvesi –

cirāya.example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako cīrāya [cirāya] bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsi. atha kho cīrāya bhikkhuniyā abhippasanno yakkho rājagahe rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi –
